content:
We are adding an "Undo" button to the message scheduling confirmation banner. Thoughts on the button color? The PR (#25349) currently has a red button, which to me makes sense but looks a bit odd visually.

Screen-Shot-2023-05-01-at-8.30.21-AM.png
Screen-Shot-2023-05-01-at-8.30.05-AM.png

CC @Vlad Korobov for your thoughts
For the light-mode version, I actually think the "yes" option needs more work. It should be a little more obvious IMHO that it's the default action.
The "Yes" option? The default action is not to do anything here.
It would be great to get some colors from Vlad for Undo here, as I just took the colors from an existing warn banner.

Alya Abbott said:

The "Yes" option? The default action is not to do anything here.

The "View Scheduled messages" button is what I meant.
Even if it's not the default action, it feels strange how it's styled.
It needs more contrast to the background behind it.

Steve Howell said:

It needs more contrast to the background behind it.

That would deem us unable to use dark greenish font color on the banner. Also, the screenshots are not fair since it actually seems nice seeing them above compose vs in the screenshot above.

The button color obscures the fact that it's a button. I think I didn't clearly specify to @Aman (amanagr) which background color I was talking about. I think the background of the button needs to change, and the banner background color should remain the same for the reason he describes.
Those are supposed to be buttons, correct? Neither of them have a button-like affordance to me. Maybe a tiny border would help?
@Vlad Korobov FYI for the banner button styling feedback, but any changes to the green button would be separate from this PR, since it's the same design as we use on other banners.

The suggestion is to have a single button UNDO. While "scheduled message" could be a link, we can tune styles of that link later.
Chances are that people don't click anything in majority of cases. Next option by expected frequency is Undo. And after that is actually viewing schedule message
Waiting for feedback from others, personally, I feel Undo should have a color that feels like a cancel operation.
@Aman (amanagr) I think that version looks great as a next iteration; I could imagine a different color on "undo" but I'm not sure what makes sense.
